lines.content: This is a project template for a greenfield Java project. It's named after the Java mascot _Duke_. Given below are instructions on how to use it.
Prerequisites: JDK 11, update Intellij to the most recent version.
1. Open Intellij (if you are not in the welcome screen, click `File` > `Close Project` to close the existing project first)
1. Open the project into Intellij as follows:
1. Select the project directory, and click `OK`.
1. If there are any further prompts, accept the defaults.
1. Configure the project to use **JDK 11** (not other versions) as explained in [here](https://www.jetbrains.com/help/idea/sdk.html#set-up-jdk).
In the same dialog, set the **Project language level** field to the `SDK default` option.

3. After that, locate the `src/main/java/duke.Duke.java` file, right-click it, and choose `Run duke.Duke.main()` (if the code editor is showing compile errors, try restarting the IDE). If the setup is correct, you should see something like the below as the output:
What can I do for you?
1. Copy `ip.jar` file into an empty folder
2. Open a command window in that folder
3. Run the command `java -jar ip.jar` (i.e., run the command in the same folder as the jar file).
4. If setup is correct, you should see below as the output:
What can I do for you?
* Represents a Deadline. A Deadline is a Task with a by
*  attribute which indicates when the task should be completed.
* Initialises Deadline object. Parses date input into a LocalDate object.
* @param by date Deadline needs to be done by
* @throws DateTimeParseException On invalid date and time inputs.
public Deadlines(String taskName, String by) throws DateTimeParseException {
* Returns string representation of Deadline, including deadline name, date and done status.
* The Duke program implements an application that
* allows users to input tasks, mark tasks as done/undone,
* Constructor. Initialises Ui, Parser, Storage and TaskList.
* Loads task list from storage and passes user input into parser.
* Creates new Duke object and runs program.
* Represents a Event. An Event is a Task with an at
*  attribute which indicates where the event is located.
* Initialises Event object. Sets location of Event.
* Returns string representation of Event, including event name, location and done status.
public static void parseInput(String input, Ui ui, Storage storage, TaskList taskList) {
throw new DukeException("OOPS!!! The description of a todo cannot be empty.");
throw new DukeException("OOPS!!! The description of a deadline cannot be empty.");
throw new DukeException("OOPS!!! /by keyword not found!");
throw new DukeException("OOPS!!! Date of deadline cannot be empty.");
System.out.println("OOPS!!! Please enter date in YYYY-MM-DD format");
throw new DukeException("OOPS!!! The description of an event cannot be empty.");
throw new DukeException("OOPS!!! /at keyword not found!");
throw new DukeException("OOPS!!! Location of event cannot be empty.");
throw new DukeException("OOPS!!! I'm sorry, but I don't know what that means :-(");
* Reads data from storage and stores in taskList.
* @param taskList taskList to store data read from storage
public static void read(TaskList taskList) throws IOException {
System.out.println("OOPS!!! Please enter date in YYYY-MM-DD format");
* Stores data from taskList into storage.
* @param taskList taskList to be stored into storage.
* Represents a task. A Task object has two attributes: task name and if the task is done.
* Initializes Task object and set done status to false.
* Returns String based on done status of task.
* @return X is task is done, else returns a space.
* Returns string representation of Task, including task name and done status.
* Set done status of task to true.
* Set done status of task to false.
* Represents a TaskList. A TaskList is an ArrayList that contains Tasks.
* Initialises TaskList object. Creates a new ArrayList.
* @param task Task to be added into TaskList.
* @param i index (from Ui) of task to mark as done
* @return Deletes task of index i - 1 from TaskList.
* Mark task from TaskList as done.
* @param i index (from Ui) of task to mark as done
* @return Marks task of index i - 1 as done.
* Mark task from TaskList as undone.
* @param i index (from Ui) of task to mark as undone
* @return Marks task of index i - 1 as undone.
* @param i index of task in TaskList.
* Prints the String representation of the TaskList.
* Returns string representation of ToDo, including ToDo name and done status.
System.out.println("What can I do for you?");
System.out.println("Bye. Hope to see you again soon!");
public void printOnAdd(Task task, TaskList taskList) {
System.out.println("Got it. I've added this task:");
System.out.println("Now you have " + taskList.size() + " task" + (taskList.size() == 1 ? " " : "s ") + "in the list");
public void printOnDelete(Task task, TaskList taskList) {
System.out.println("Now you have " + taskList.size() + " task" + (taskList.size() == 1 ? " " : "s ") + "in the list");
System.out.println("Nice! I've marked this task as done: ");
System.out.println("Ok. I've marked this task as not done yet: ");
System.out.println("There are currently no tasks in the list.");
System.out.println("Here are the tasks in your list:");
System.out.println("There are no matching tasks in your list.");
System.out.println("Here are the matching tasks in your list:");
